distribution.text: Copyright Â© Red Hat, Inc. All rights reserved.

notes.text:
An update for emacs is now available for Red Hat Enterprise Linux 9.

Red Hat Product Security has rated this update as having a security impact of Moderate. A Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS) base score, which gives a detailed severity rating, is available for each vulnerability from the CVE link(s) in the References section.
notes.title: Topic

notes.text:
GNU Emacs is a powerful, customizable, self-documenting text editor. It provides special code editing features, a scripting language (elisp), and the capability to read e-mail and news.

Security Fix(es):

* emacs: org-link-expand-abbrev: Do not evaluate arbitrary unsafe Elisp code (CVE-2024-39331)

For more details about the security issue(s), including the impact, a CVSS score, acknowledgments, and other related information, refer to the CVE page(s) listed in the References section.
notes.title: Details

cwe.name: Improper Neutralization of Directives in Dynamically Evaluated Code ('Eval Injection')

notes.text: A flaw was found in Emacs. Arbitrary shell commands can be executed without prompting when an Org mode file is opened or when the Org mode is enabled, when Emacs is used as an email client, this issue can be triggered when previewing email attachments.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: emacs: org-link-expand-abbrev: Do not evaluate arbitrary unsafe Elisp code
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: To exploit this flaw, an attacker needs to trick a user into opening a crafted Org mode file or previewing a crafted email attachment. For this reason, this flaw has been rated with a Moderate security impact.
notes.title: Statement

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258
Do not open Org mode files or preview email attachments from untrusted sources.

vulnerabilities.title: emacs: org-link-expand-abbrev: Do not evaluate arbitrary unsafe Elisp code
